bug.short_desc: real player plugin reports false VIDEO name for download,and file is downloaded with a fake name ,usually the name of a tag.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2) Gecko/20100115 Firefox/3.6 Build Identifier: firefox 4 [UNINSTALLED & USING THE NICE VERSION 3]
Discovered this while using facebook.opening a youtube file link from facebook [and elsewhere] ,then trying using real downloader to download it,downloads it with a false name ,usually is one of the tags thats opened at the moment. FIREFOX 3 DOESNT HAVE THIS BUG,JUST UNINSTALLED MFIREFOX 4 ,INSTALLED 3,6RC2 and everything is fine.Also didi installed latest Real player version.So this same plugin works with 3.6 andnot with 4
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.open some tabs, 2.try open a youtube video lined to facebook or elsewhere 3.try use real downloader to download this. Actual Results: mistaken file name of the downloaded file
Expected Results: mistaken file name of the downloaded file
downlod file with proper filename as its appears to be on youtube.

Works for me on: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110406 Firefox/4.2a1pre with videos on Youtube. Although the Real Player Plugin does not recognize file names properly with the videos on Facebook.
Anyway, IMO this is not a Firefox problem but a Real Player one. Got the same behavior on Firefox 3.6.16, as well, so there is no need to switch to an older build. Remaining UNCONFIRMED
